item.title: CEOs haven’t felt this pessimistic about American business conditions since spring 2020, when the deadly coronavirus sent everyone home from work
item.description: Just under half of the CEOs surveyed expected a recession or slowdown in the next six months.

item.title: BlackRock CEO sounds the alarm to Trump on the scarcity of this skilled trade profession—but Gen Z may be able to save the day
item.description: The U.S. may soon run out of electricians thanks to data center demand and nationalist immigration policies, warns BlackRock CEO Larry Fink.

item.title: Goldman Sachs’ chief economist just downgraded the entire U.S. economy as Trump’s latest tariff salvo rattles markets
item.description: The storied investment bank has forecast GDP growth to come in below Wall Street’s consensus for the first time in 2½ years.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump’s presidential pressure on the Fed is nothing new—but impact is limited
item.description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon is unsurprised by President Trump's push for lower inflation and interest rates—but warns that doesn't mean the Oval Office c...

item.title: Tesla owners offloading their cars over Elon Musk backlash are in for a nasty surprise
item.description: A different kind of sticker shock.
